posts.post_content:
Great art, and managed to win me a sealed event : (twas a FNM event though, so all I got for my troubles was a [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf), but I digress)   
The ability to stop activated abilities in any case is nice, but in RoE it's quite a powerhouse. Literally the only games I lost when I played Linvala were games in which my opponent managed to kill her.   
Outside of the land of envokers, levelers, and eldrazi spawn, there is clearly less potential for her to shine. But a 3/4 flier for four is, as others have said, quite spectacular.  
  
5/5 imo. The art is what tips the scale.
posts.html:

The ability to stop activated abilities in any case is nice, but in RoE it's quite a powerhouse. Literally the only games I lost when I played Linvala were games in which my opponent managed to kill her.
Outside of the land of envokers, levelers, and eldrazi spawn, there is clearly less potential for her to shine. But a 3/4 flier for four is, as others have said, quite spectacular.

5/5 imo. The art is what tips the scale.

posts.post_content:
Note to everybody who's asking about activated abilities:  
  
Activated abilities have the format (cost)**:**(effect)  
ex. (tap): add one mana of any color to your mana pool  
 Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card  
  
always take note of the colons that separate the cost and effect
posts.html:
Note to everybody who's asking about activated abilities:

Activated abilities have the format (cost):(effect)
ex. (tap): add one mana of any color to your mana pool
Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card

always take note of the colons that separate the cost and effect

Posted By: psychichobo (6/12/2013 9:47:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Such a frustrating card against elf decks. It's not usually good enough to main board multiples of compared to other 4 drops, but a singleton can be effective against many decks. In my case, I was playing a game 3 on MWS, and the opponent wanted to swap decks - which I hate, as the matches are supposed to be best of 3 with the same decks to allow for variance. So I swapped to my elf deck, which generally punishes people for swapping to a counter-the-other-deck deck.  
  
I didn't have the fastest hand, but after my turn 4 I was ready to Genesis Wave for the game next turn. He drops turn 4 Linvala, and I'm just like "really? How often do you see that outside of EDH, and yet here it is...". I conceded right there my only hope would've been to draw 2 additional lands and play the Eldrazi Monument in my hand, but even that probably wouldn't have been enough.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Every single time I see her in a game of EDH, I laugh; I know her owner is going to suffer like no one else under the wrath of everyone else at the table. I can't think of many other cards that anger players so easily.   
  
You play cards that stop people from playing their deck, and people will stop you from playing yours. Tit-for-tat, you know? At least she has pretty art. :-D
